titleStmt.title: Concordance lexical entry for lemma: NeededMixtecVocab2-20170807-TS.xml

cit.quote: Chaa ntsanu ka , koo ka ixi xini ra
The old man's head is bald.
La cabeza del anciano es calva.

sense.note: this is not inflected for person because the person is stated explicitly (kue nivi)/

cit.quote: Kini ini kue nivi ña kitsaa ñuu .
The people that arrived in town are mean.
La gente que llegan en el pueblo son tacaños.

sense.note: collocate (the street); should this be "kua'a ya'a" or is this correct? (or does it vary like "kuanu'u" ~"kua'a nu'u")

cit.quote: Kucha so'o nchii ntatu'un kue nivi
I hear what the people are saying I hear what the people (have been?) saying
Oigo lo que dice la gente
They will stop and we'll eat tortillas. Is this "Kunchatu na katso staa" (They will stop and we will eat tortillas) or "Kunchatu nakatso staa"? (Let's stop and eat tortillas)
Van a parar y vamos a comer tortillas.
Na'a katsi staa yo'o , va'a tsatsia
Let's eat this tortilla, it's good!
Let's kill it! should this be "ka'no"? (1pl. as in"katso"?) or should "na" be "ña" and the verb "ka'nu"? where is the object of the sentence?

sense.note: this should probably be "Ntavi ini" ("inia" is inflected for 3sg)

cit.quote: The black bull is too big.
El toro negro es demadiado grande.
Va'a kita'an ini yu tsi ñani yu
I get along well with my brother.
Me llevo bien con mi hermano.
Este gato es mu chiste. Estoy triste que..?.
Va'a kita'an ini yu tsi ñani yu
I get along well with my brother.
Me llevo bien con mi hermano.

sense.note: this should probably be "Ntavi ini" ("inia" is inflected for 3sg)

form.note: should this be "ini"? "inu" seems like it should be 2nd person but the use of 1sg possesive seems to be speaking about the friend. Unless it is saying "you are very kind my friend".

sense.note: should this be "ini"? "inu" seems like it should be 2nd person but the use of 1sg possesive seems to be speaking about the friend. Unless it is saying "you are very kind my friend".

cit.quote: Chaa ntsanu ka , koo ka ixi xini ra
The old man's head is bald.
La cabeza del anciano es calva.
Chaa ntsanu ka , koo ka ixi xini ra
The old man's head is bald.
La cabeza del anciano es calva.
The black bull is too big.
El toro negro es demadiado grande.

sense.note: check on how to spell import words form Spanish with [h]

cit.quote: Na'a katsi staa yo'o , va'a tsatsia
Let's eat this tortilla, it's good!
Va'a kita'an ini yu tsi ñani yu
I get along well with my brother.
Me llevo bien con mi hermano.

sense.note: this also is not inflected (for person) and appears to be present tense (as the past would be "nikitsaa"). Also is this arrive or begin? (i.e. 'the founders of the town')?

cit.quote: Kini ini kue nivi ña kitsaa ñuu .

La gente que llegan en el pueblo son tacaños.

cit.quote: Va'a kita'an ini yu tsi ñani yu
I get along well with my brother.
Me llevo bien con mi hermano.
Na'a katsi staa yo'o , va'a tsatsia
Let's eat this tortilla, it's good!
Este gato es mu chiste. Estoy triste que..?.

sense.note: is this inflected for person? I have "xiko" as the gloss form of 'to sell'. Should it be spelled "xíkui"?
